channel.title: AI Zen with Andrew and Jen edit-
channel.description: podcast where a designer and a data scientist break down how to create awesome AI experiences. Twitter: @AIZenPodcast
channel.itunes:author: Andrew Freed & Jennifer Sukis

item.title: Privacy by Design
item.description: In this episode we get to talk with Nishant Bhajaria, author of Privacy by Design and leader of data privacy teams at Google, Uber, Netflix and Nike about designing and developing ways to protect your users and their data.
item.itunes:author: Andrew Freed & Jennifer Sukis

item.title: The need to know what we don't know
item.description: We all have implicit biases and assumptions that come into play whenever we're designing and building stuff. Jen and Andrew share the sad, the horrifying and the sometimes amusing stories of what happens when we don't ask what we don't know and just keep on going without identifying our blindspots.
item.itunes:author: Andrew Freed & Jennifer Sukis

item.title: The future of designing the future
item.description: Andrew and Jen bounce ideas around with futurist Clayton Bunyard, Ph.D., about biological design thinking, weird skills we'll need in the future, STEM vs STEAM, and how video conferencing tools are going to get much, much better.
item.itunes:author: Andrew Freed & Jennifer Sukis

item.title: Designing valuable, feasible AI use cases
item.description: Andrew asks Jen about her methods for helping teams vet and prioritize all the ways AI could be designed into their products.
item.itunes:author: Andrew Freed & Jennifer Sukis

item.title: AI under the hood
item.description: Jen and Andrew get into the inner workings of a few simple AI applications and exactly HOW those magic-like experiences are built.
item.itunes:author: Andrew Freed & Jennifer Sukis

item.title: AI we can be thankful for
item.description: AI has done so many good things for us already. For Thanksgiving, Andrew and Jen reflect on how AI is improving our lives, our world, and our futures.
item.itunes:author: Andrew Freed & Jennifer Sukis

item.title: AI horror show!
item.description: Three tales of AI nightmares and apocalyptic robots. Andrew and Jen go to the dark places of our possible horrific futures with AI.
item.itunes:author: Andrew Freed & Jennifer Sukis

item.title: Data drives research, drives design, drives data
item.description: Keith Vertrees, Director of User Research with a background in data science, talks data driven design, the data skills designers need, and why we should spend 90% of our time identifying the problem.
item.itunes:author: Andrew Freed & Jennifer Sukis

item.title: Can data and design come together?
item.description: What's going happen as data and design teams work closer and closer together to continuously deliver AI? Will roles overlap? Will skills transfer?
item.itunes:author: Andrew Freed & Jennifer Sukis

item.title: A wee bit about model maintenance
item.description: Why can't I just launch my AI widget and be done? Andrew tells us about what to expect and plan for once you've set your AI free.
item.itunes:author: Andrew Freed & Jennifer Sukis

item.title: Oh no, AI mistakes!
item.description: Did you know you can design your AI system to tell you how it needs to be fixed? In episode three we talk about some real world examples of false/positives and true/negatives.
item.itunes:author: Andrew Freed & Jennifer Sukis

item.title: Designing with AI
item.description: How designing for AI is the same as designing for "not AI" and how it differs from other types of design. The kinds of things AI can be used to design for.
item.itunes:author: Andrew Freed & Jennifer Sukis

item.title: Starting your AI project
item.description: My executive told me to add AI to my project, now what? Should I use AI or rules? Adding ML to your project.
item.itunes:author: Andrew Freed & Jennifer Sukis
